Description: Mycenaean/Late Helladic pottery globular stirrup jar, Furumark Shape 171. Restored from fragments. Body painted with thick and thin red-brown bands. Multiple stem (FM 19) patterns and bars in shoulder zone. Handles solid painted with reserved triangle either side of concentric circles on false mouth.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt) (said to be from)
Curator's comments: For an early notice of this vessel and of other Mycenaean vases from Egypt, see Furtwaengler and Loeschcke 1886, 31ff and 82. Bibliography: Furtwaengler, A. and Loeschcke, G. 1886. Mykenische Vasen. Vorhellenische Thongefässe aus dem Gebiete des Mittelmeeres (Berlin: A. Asher).
